title: Gabriel Jesus insists he does not know when he will return to Manchester City action
text:
Sport Gabriel Jesus insists he does not know when he will return to Manchester City action Jesus was still using crutches during a promotional visit to New York this week but he is hopeful he can still play this season Share Gabriel Jesus in New York following a promotional visit with City (Photo: Instagram/dejesusoficial) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Gabriel Jesus still does not know when he will play for Manchester City again. 
The Brazilian sensation insists that he is hopeful of returning to the pitch this season with the help of City's medical staff. 
Jesus, 19, has spent this week in New York as part of the promotion of City's pre-season tour of the United States. Jesus with Andrea Pirlo on a visit to New York City FC (Photo: dejesusoficial/Instagram) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Gabriel Jesus living it up watching the NBA in New York Share this video The reason why Guardiola has BANNED chocolate for everyone at City's HQ 
However, Jesus is still using crutches, and admitted he found it difficult at first to adjust to such an extended period on the sidelines. 
But he is convinced the decision to operate on the fractured metatarsal, sustained against Bournemouth in February, was correct in the long term. 
The City star told Brazilian outlet SporTV: “It’s good. Thank God, the effort, not just mine, but from all the physiotherapists in Manchester, doctors and everyone. It was not easy for me. Jesus suffered a broken metatarsal during City's game at Bournemouth (Photo: Michael Steele / Getty) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Injured Gabriel Jesus uses MOBILITY SCOOTER to get around during rehab Share this video Watch Next 
"It’s my first injury. Not muscle injury, but it’s the first time something happens that leaves me out of games. So it was not easy. But I saw that, of course, no one wants this to happen, but it could be worse. So we operated soon, I decided to operate and give it time.” 
An expected recovery time would be between two and three months, meaning that Jesus could return in time for the final weeks of the season - and a possible appearance in the FA Cup Final, should City win their semi-final against Arsenal next month. 
He added: "I don’t know, I have no return prediction. But I hope I can still play some games this season.” poll loading Will Gabriel Jesus replace Sergio Aguero as the main man at City next season? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
